channel.title: My eyes r killing me
channel.description:
Yeh so umm, for like 5 years straight i used to look at my old 17" lcd monitor in 1280x960 res or whatever it is, and it was fine.. 2 months ago i brought a 22" widescreen 2243BW monitor and i use it in 1680x1050. now over the last 2 months its gotta be the sickest time of my life, ive been sick as hell, my eyes have been fucking killing me and ive been getting dizzy/fainty and can barely look at my computer screen for more than 1-2 hours now without it killing me.
So i didnt know the cause at all and im not sure if i still do, but yesterday my ex gf had to use my computer for a few mins, and after a few mins she said ouch that hurts my eyes etc, so im starting to think this monitor is fucked up. shes like "it feels like watching a tv screen from half a meter away" and now that i think of it, it does feel like that.
Anyway so is this a posibility of whats screwing around with my eyes, im gonna go back to my old monitor soon, but fuck i love this monitor, so big and sexy and expensive.
Im writing this on ex gf's laptop right now, and suprisingly my eyes arnt hurting at all, so i may have found the solution.
Also i thought it was time that i needed glasses (its gonna happen sooner or later) so i tried some out, and every fuckin pair of glasses i tried on, all gave me blurry vision, so obviously i dont need them.

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @Cald_Panda Cald Panda
item.description:
@Cald_Panda wrote:

lol at the eyes.

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

apart from me owning yz in rage battles on irc, i sold my large monitor for 250$ now im gonna save up 100$ and get some new speakers (logitech z-5500) so hopfully my ears wont fuck up after that.

The PC has been okay lately, though its fucked, ive spent around 1-2 hours everyday on my pc and i get bored so fast… used to not get bored being on there 10 hours, needs more projects imo, more games, more things to do. fucking hurry up quake live open beta and let me become a nerd again, i got all da gears for it waitin to use em.

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:23, topic:231596”][quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=305049.msg2463062#msg2463062 date=1222570378]
I used to have this problem, the thing is you could be leaning in too close fropm the monitor.

If not, just do what I do. looking at a bright screen can cause irritations in the eye so every hour or so, take a break and just look at something far off for 1-5 minutes (ex: sky) and your problem should stop.

Tell me if it works
[/quote]
Remember that xEnt is constantly on the computer, has a massive high definition monitor and is constantly being raged at in IRC by me <3.[/quote]Ok, but wouldn’t it be better if he could take even MORE rage from you for a couple more hours?

Read full topic

I was lazy and didn’t felt like going to the optician. I didn’t want glasses, and I thougth contacts hurted. I even fucked up maths because I sat in the back of the classroom and couldn’t read what was written on the chalkboard. After getting contacts, everything became much better.

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

OK guys, i went to the eye doctor, he says im short sighted, did some eye tests and now i gotta pay 390$ for some special glasses.

Hes like, look outside thats what you see now, slips the glasses on me this is what you should be seeing…

its fucking amazing, it was like jumping from DX9 to DX10 with AA on 4x seriously everything was clearer, smoother, closer and overall much better (even though i didn’t think anything was wrong with my eyes in the first place)

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Lately ive been taking tons of breaks and ive been off the computer for the whole day, yet my eyes still feel heavy and my reaction time on things are so slow… if i shake my head and try to focus on something instantly, it wont actually be clear until a second after, its fucked.

I didnt know brightness would have anything to do with this, my last monitor was extremely bright, this monitor i got has a 8000:1 contrast ratio whatever that means, ill check out an eye doctor soon i guess, just been lazy really.

I highly doubt its the brightness, but im going to pick up my old monitor today and use it for a few days, see how it is.

I hear its bad to watch a monitor in the dark, well i pretty much did this for years as i liked my room having a pitch black emo feel to it, its peaceful, anyway this is gay maybe i do need glasses or somethin, ill see whenever i book into an eye doctor.

Also i do sit far back from the monitor as possible, that has not helped.

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

… All I did was look at your name before I bothered to read the reply to know how stupid it would be.

Nonetheless, I have a different problem with my eyes, which is somewhat affected by the computer. I sometimes get visual migraines, which last for about 30 mins - 1 hour, which is followed by a huge headache. I used to get them from sitting on the computer, but now I’ve figured out that they are triggered by a certain feeling (stress, etc) or by eating something. What they do is literally blur parts of your eyes making it insanely hard to see. It’s somewhat relevant, but not really.

Anyways, what I suggest is talking to your eye doctor, and perhaps by taking frequent breaks every hour or so, to help your eyes out. If it continues, switch back to your old monitor and try the same.

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me

item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

You might have Hurting eye syndrome from wide monitors sysndrome disease.

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah as said before; try adjusting the brightness. Do this periodically and find what brightness best suites your eyes.

E.g. one day have it on full brightness, the next a step lower and so on untill you comfortable with it.

If that still doesn’t help then its gotta be the size that is the problem, in that case it’d be a good idea to try sitting a few inches further from your screen.

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

Is it a dark room/area? Your eyes will hurt if your on the computer too long in a dark area. Adjust the brightness in the room.

Read full topic

item.title: My eyes r killing me
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You have to try glasses that have the right correction. I don’t know what system you use in Australia, but over here it’s +1 +2 etc for those who can’t see much thats close and -1 -2 etc… for those who can’t see clear at a distance. If it’s not right, you get a blurry vision and a headache.

But yea, go see a doctor.

Read full topic
